title: Ne m'abandonne pas
text:
Ne m'abandonne pas (French: "Do Not Abandon Me") is a French TV movie directed by Xavier Durringer, which was broadcast on 3 February 2016 on <a href="France%202">France 2</a>. The film deals with the topic of young French Muslims who are radicalized and encouraged to go to Syria to join the <a href="Syrian%20civil%20war">civil war</a>.
Synopsis.
A French woman experiences her worst nightmare when she discovers that her 17-year-old daughter has been radicalized and plans to travel to Syria to meet her new husband, a <a href="Jihadism">jihadist</a> she met online. In order to prevent this, the mother decides to completely isolate her daughter.
Legacy.
A petition was launched in 2016 to request the broadcast of the film in all French high schools. Addressed to <a href="Najat%20Vallaud-Belkacem">Najat Vallaud-Belkacem</a>, the French Minister of National Education, the petition succeeded in reaching its objective of 43,172 signatures, and the Minister responded favourably to the project.
